page.title: 12GILLINGHAM CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: 1B surveyed roughly 50 different people about what games they play or played when they were younger. The information was collected on survey sheets, and compared to what games we played now.The ages surveyed were from adult to infant. The most popular games seem to be games using balls, e.g. football and rounders; games of violence, e.g. British Bulldog; and games such as tag, e.g. 999. According to our survey most games played now have some ancestor played years ago, e.g. 999 and Colt 45 evolved from simple games of tag.In some of the games some of the rules have changed but most of them are very similar.Some games have died out: Marbles and Conkers. Conkers died out here because of school rules.
